text: Where the Earth Meets the Sky is a sculpture by Phillip K. Smith III, installed outside Oklahoma City's City Hall, in the U.S. state of Oklahoma. ==Description and history== The sculpture, 2019 The tall sculpture, installed in 2012, is made of powder coated steel, stainless steel, concrete, bronze, and LED lighting. The base is circular and red, and the sculpture becomes increasingly modular and reflective with height. Smith has said of the artwork: The work is part of the City of Oklahoma City Public Art collection. ==See also== * 2012 in art ==References== Category:2012 establishments in Oklahoma Category:2012 sculptures Category:Bronze sculptures in Oklahoma Category:Concrete sculptures in the United States Category:Outdoor sculptures in Oklahoma City Category:Stainless steel sculptures in the United States Category:Steel sculptures in the United States
title: Where the Earth Meets the Sky
